name: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club

reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, greate location
reviews.text: This is a Marriott timeshare resort, we traded our week in Orlando for a week in a 2 bedroom unit.

reviews.title: A Pleasant Suprise
reviews.text: We stayed in the newly opened tower, with a mountain view.

reviews.title: Not for Solo or Business Travelers
reviews.text: We were impressed by the size of the resort, the location was great with many pools and and ocean lagoon.

reviews.title: Overall, I would recommend Ko Olina.
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful, everything here was top notch.

reviews.title: Outstanding property!!!
reviews.text: Very nice contrast to the city hustle-bustle of Waikiki.

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club about two weeks ago for five days. We were assigned a studio that faced the parking lot, but other than that, everything else was great. The property is beautiful and pleasant with lots of palm trees and flowers. Owners have access to a private beach right outside in the common area. It's just a very well-designed, clean, secluded beach area. There is a free shuttle that takes people to the Marriott Golf Club (where Roy's is located) close by and the Marriott Hotel about 2 minutes down the road. The restaurant at the hotel, Azul, is superb. If you request to sit outside, you are steps away from sting rays and small sharks (not sure what they are called) that roam around in a pool. The designs/architectures indoors and outdoors are beautiful and magnificent with huge white columns and lots of greeneries. The most important aspect , of course, is the food. It's excellent and very reasonably priced. Back to discussing the Marriott Ko Olina...The location is great. You are about 5-10 minutes away from Costco, Safeway and Long's Drugs. There is a huge shopping plaza in the same area. You can find lots of restaurants there, too. Yes, it's about 30 minutes away from downtown Honolulu, but it's not so bad. I guess if you prefer staying in a quieter area, it's a better choice. The only downside is the parking - it's like $20 some dollars a day for self parking.

reviews.title: The Best Resort On Oahu Hands Down!
reviews.text: You can't get much better then this resort. From the villas that face the ocean to the service, this resort cannot be beat! We stayed in a gorgeous 1 bedroom villa overlooking one of Ko Olina's 4 lagoons. The villas themselves are probably around 1,000 sq feet for a 1 bedroom and feature a full kitchen with everything you need to make a perfect meal. They also feature a washer and dryer which comes in handy. There's a bathroom with a toilet, sink, and shower, then another bathroom with just a sink and oversized bathtub. The villa also has a small reading room with what I call a mini bed. Overall you can't beat these rooms, they have everything you need for your entire stay not to mention all the room you could ask for, and the balcony was a fairly good size featuring a table with two chairs and a lounger. You can't beat eating breakfast in the morning overlooking the ocean and also eating dinner watching the sunset. Talk about a romantic dinner! The resort has their own market which has a starbucks and sells some other food items as well as some grocery items. But your better off going to the Safeway just down the H1 freeway to save some $$$. During our stay we ate at Chuck's SteakHouse which had some pretty tasty steaks cooked to perfection and all meals include their salad bar which was average. Resort also features activities you can take part in from hula lessons and yoga to hawaiian style bowling. They also feature 3 pools and numerous jacuzzi's. And their beaches are great that's all you have to do is go down early and grab your chairs and put your hotel issued towel on them and don't have to worry about anyone taking your spot, it's great! Bottom line, if your looking for a secluded resort outside of Waikiki this is the place! They have it all here for you not to mention to superb service. Everyone from the valet and bellhops to groundscrew were super friendly and if you needed something they would help you. Awesome stay, we'll surely be staying here again in a few years.

reviews.title: Best place in Oahu
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in late February. I have traveled quite a bit and must say I was very impressed with this resort. The on-line pictures don't do it justice. The grounds were impeccable, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, the rooms were extremely comfortable and clean. We didn't even need the mid-week maid service; in fact, it saved us the hassle of worrying about any valuables left in the room while we were out. This resort is ideal for couples wanting a romantic, quiet vacation. It's also perfect for families with small children. The resort is huge and plenty of space to spread out. We didn't feel crowded at all.

reviews.title: Great Hotel (Rental Car a must)
reviews.text: We reserved a Queen bed w/ Mountain View. We were pleasantly surprised to find a California King bed, sofa and kitchenette (small fridge, microwave, toaster, dishes for 2, coffee maker & even came with dish soap, sponge and paper towels). The water view would have been much nicer, but the mountain view wasn't bad. It overlooked the golf course and some housing developments at a distance. We save a lot of money by selecting a Mountain View. The marble counter tops in the kitchenette and bathroom were a nice touch. It's a gorgeous property! Guests have access to 4 lagoons for swimming and snorkeling. (You can buy snorkels at the Marketplace or local Wal-mart for cheaper than buying them in advance and packing them ~$29). The pools at this resort were very elaborate w/ waterfalls, a water slide and cabana bar service). Shaved ice was only $3 and cocktails available at the bar. Adult beverages and food is a bit pricey, but worth the splurge on vacation. We took a trip with Safe-way Foods on our first day to purchase breakfast foods, fresh fruit, drinks (including liquor), etc. We actually bought a small blender at Wal-mart to make our own frosty beverages. Much to our surprise, Wal-mart was also the best place for small token souvenirs. We didn't do a Luau because I'm vegetarian and they don't cater to non-meat eaters. Instead, we opted for the luau at the Polynesian Cultural Center.

reviews.title: Excellent Resort - Luxuary Rooms
reviews.text: This resort is a timeshare property. If you have the opportunity to take the 90-minute preview - Go! You'll get to choose from a gift excursion (to name a few: catamaran snorkeling tour, whale/dolphin watching, sunset cocktail cruise). It doesn't take much to qualify for the timeshare preview and it was nice to tour the larger 2 BR units w/ full kitchen. We chose not to buy, but didn't feel any high pressure either. Everyone was incredibly friendly! Be sure to attend the activity preview at the beginning of the week and register for free door prize drawings. It gives you a taste of all amenities available during your stay. Fia Fia is a free show on the lawn mid-week. Pool towels are plentiful. There are at least 4-5 restaurants on the resort that you can charge to your room. The Marketplace sells Starbucks coffee and has a pre-packaged section stocked with goodies from Cheesecake Factory, Coldstone Ice cream (whole b-day cakes sold here), drinks, fruit/cheese, etc.

reviews.title: Nice property marred by the gross lack of customer service
reviews.text: The location is beautiful and I think I would have had a nice trip were it not for a horrible customer service experience. Definitely a case of a small issue becoming a huge distracting problem for the entire week.

reviews.title: Fantastic Place for Families
reviews.text: We requested a room change - did not want the handi-accessible room as it did not have the dual vanity and tub. We even were willing to give up our 'ocean view' for a island view. The manager said she'd be willing to accomodate with 24hr advance notice and therefore she could switch us the next day. We call down the next day, and get the same runaround. - "We can accomodate tomorrow, please call us back tomorrow morning and we will have something for you..." What about our conversation the previous day? Oh, sorry, no record of that, but just call us back tomorrow. Incredible!

reviews.title: About as good as it gets for families with children
reviews.text: We stayed here after a fairly horrific experience at the Moana Surfrider, and thank goodness as it redeemed our Hawaiian vacation! I can't say enough about how kid and family friendly this resort is. The rooms are well-appointed, there are lots of great amenities and activities (go to the morning fish feeding if you can), and I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful without being overbearing or fake.

reviews.title: Lovely property- a few service/staff issues
reviews.text: If you're going on a family vacation to Oahu, this is the place to stay. And I've learned that if your kids have a great vacation, so will you!

reviews.title: Paradise on Earth
reviews.text: There are tons for reviews for this resort so what else can I say? Well we never saw the rest of the island except for the Target, Safeway, and Costco. Is that a good thing? I think so. We have 3 kids and our youngest is 2 so we don't like to drive around too much and lug all their junk around. So we found enough to do here to keep everyone happy for a full week. Fishing off the rocks just outside the lagoon. Snorkeling in the lagoon. Kayaking in the lagoon. Checking out the tide pools in the lagoon. But that is not all. The pools are really nice also. The newer section has a medium level water slide. Warm waters, waterfalls, jacuzzi, sandy bottom pool. There is even a dry sauna and steam room that you can use without signing up for a spa session. That is rare that you have access to those without paying extra for the spa. We did not use the spa itself, but it did look a little small and unimpressive. Restaurants are good enough, but you can't eat in just 2 places for your whole stay. We prepared most our food in the kitchen and on the numerous outdoor grills. Never had a problem getting one.

reviews.title: Stay here and forget about Waikiki
reviews.text: If you are going to Oahu and want a great Hawaii experience, then stay here. Most people want to stay in Waikiki because that's the famous location, but its like staying right in the middle of a major downtown business district. If that's what you want then go for it.....

reviews.title: Fantastic FAMILY Resort (even with the wind...)
reviews.text: If you want quiet, peaceful setting with private beaches ( and I mean 4 beaches), protected lagoons with tropical fish and great snorkeling, beautiful tropical grounds and quiet, then this is the place for you. Did I mention that they have three different pools, with related soaking pools and a waterslide for the kids all set in a tropical setting with palm trees and tropical vegetation for atmosphere.

reviews.title: Not for couples or singles
reviews.text: I'd recommend it to anyone. Its about 30 miles north of Honolulu on the west coast. Its beautiful!

reviews.title: Excellent Vacation at Marriott Ko Olina
reviews.text: OK, I would have to agree with the previous post that it would not be the best spot for a couple looking to relax (or get away from kids). However, for those of us with kids it was wonderful. We are owners but we'd never been. We used the 1 bedroom portion and found it to be perfect (4 yr old slept in the enclosed lanai off the master bdrm on the little couch, son on sofa bed in main room). Brought very little clothes and used the washer/dryer daily. We were on the 6th floor of the Moana Tower with an ocean view.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: We were there from 3/29 - 4/5 and the only downside to our trip was the 7 day WIND (several locals told me it was unusual to have so many consecutive days of strong winds....) So we spent more time in the wind protected pools vs the beach, but that was OK because my kids loved the water slide, the water falls and the FAMILY hot tubs (the pic of the pool above is very old. It's now the lagoon pool and has a sand bottom/beach, volleyball and bball & lots more rocks and plants). I'm attaching pool pics & video. On the calmer days the beach was great. We snorkeled and saw lots of cool fish (by the rocks). The lagoon is well protected so it's VERY calm. In fact, my kids (4 & 9) wanted some wave action so we asked the concierge for advise and she recommended Barber's Point and gave us written directions (5-10 min).

aka: Marriott`s Ko Olina Beach Club Hotel Kapolei
